verses.verse: Now Sarai<WH8297>, Abram<WH87>'s wife<WH802>, bare<WH3205> him no<WH3808> children<WH3205>: and she had a handmaid<WH8198>, an Egyptian<WH4713>, whose name<WH8034> was Hagar<WH1904>.

And Abram hearkened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of Sarai<WH8297>.

And Sarai<WH8297>, Abram<WH87>'s wife<WH802>, took<WH3947> Hagar<WH1904> the Egyptian<WH4713>, her handmaid<WH8198>, after<WH7093> Abram<WH87> had dwelt<WH3427> ten<WH6235> years<WH8141> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and gave<WH5414> her to Abram<WH87> her husband<WH376> to be his wife<WH802>.
And he went in<WH935> unto Hagar<WH1904>, and she conceived<WH2029>: and when she saw<WH7200> that she had conceived<WH2029>, her mistress<WH1404> was despised<WH7043> in her eyes<WH5869>.

And Sarai<WH8297> said<WH559> unto Abram<WH87>, My wrong<WH2555> be upon thee<WH5414>: I gave my handmaid<WH8198> into thy bosom<WH2436>; and when she saw<WH7200> that she had conceived<WH2029>, I was despised<WH7043> in her eyes<WH5869>: Jehovah<WH3068> judge between me and thee<WH8199>.

But Abram<WH87> said<WH559> unto Sarai<WH8297>, Behold<WH8198>, thy maid is in thy hand<WH3027>; do<WH6213> to her that which is good in thine<WH2896> eyes<WH8297>. And Sarai dealt hardly with<WH6031> her<WH1272>, and she fled from her face<WH6440>.
And the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068> found her<WH4672> by a fountain<WH5869> of water<WH4325> in the wilderness<WH4057>, by the fountain<WH5869> in the way<WH1870> to Shur<WH7793>.

And he said<WH559>, Hagar<WH1904>, Sarai<WH8297>'s handmaid<WH8198>, whence<WH335> camest thou<WH935>? and whither goest<WH3212> thou<WH559>? And she said, I am fleeing<WH1272> from the face<WH6440> of my mistress<WH1404> Sarai<WH8297>.
And the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto her<WH7725>, Return to thy mistress<WH1404>, and submit<WH6031> thyself under her hands<WH3027>.
And the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto her<WH7235>, I will greatly multiply<WH7235> thy seed<WH2233>, that it shall not be numbered<WH5608> for multitude<WH7230>.

And the angel<WH4397> of Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto her<WH2009>, Behold, thou art with child<WH2030>, and shalt bear<WH3205> a son<WH1121>; and thou shalt call<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Ishmael<WH3458>, because Jehovah<WH3068> hath heard<WH8085> thy affliction<WH6040>.

And she called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068> that spake<WH1696> unto her<WH410>, Thou art a God that seeth<WH7210>: for she said<WH559>, Have I even here<WH1988> looked<WH7200> after him<WH310> that seeth me<WH7210>?
